thread.title: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain was furious with his teammates during Arsenal's humiliating loss to Bayern Munich
thread.title_full: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain was furious with his teammates during Arsenal's humiliating loss to Bayern Munich

author: Liam Corless
title: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain was furious with his teammates during Arsenal's humiliating loss to Bayern Munich

organizations.name: bayern munich share get arsenal fc

text:
Frustration got the better of Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain against Bayern Munich Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain's body language in the closing stages of Arsenal's defeat by Bayern Munich pretty much summed up how all Gunners fans were feeling. 
The 23-year-old let frustration get the better of him as he threw a mini tantrum at his own teammates for not closing down Bayern's players. 
Oxlade-Chamberlain was attempting to win the ball back as Arturo Vidal and Philipp Lahm passed it between themselves and was visibly livid when he turned around to see that nobody else had followed suit. 
He jumped in the air in frustration before barking angry remarks back at his colleagues. 
Arsenal's Champions League hopes are virtually over for another year after they were humbled 5-1 in the first leg of their last-16 tie at the Allianz Arena. The midfielder was closing down Philipp Lahm and Arturo Vidal (Photo: BT SPORT) His attempt to win the ball back was fruitless (Photo: BT SPORT) Oxlade-Chamberlain was visibly livid when he turned around to see none of his teammates were trying to win the ball back (Photo: BT SPORT) It was a miserable night for Arsenal in Bavaria (Photo: BT SPORT) 
Arjen Robben opened the scoring with a sumptuous long-range effort but Alexis Sanchez ensured Arsenal went in level at the break after volleying the ball into the bottom corner. 
Bayern scored three times within 10 second-half minutes to go 4-1 up, with Robert Lewandowski reinstating the hosts' lead before Thiago Alcantara notched a brace. 
Thomas Muller rounded off the scoring two minutes from full-time when he capitalised on an error by Oxlade-Chamberlain to drill the ball past David Ospina and into the bottom corner. Read More Arjen Robben scored the opening goal of the night for the hosts (Photo: Bongarts/Getty Images) Alexis Sanchez notched the equaliser to give Arsenal hope at half-time (Photo: REUTERS) The night went downhill after the interval and Thomas Muller scored Bayern's fifth two minutes from time (Photo: Bongarts/Getty Images) Oxlade-Chamberlain cut a dejected figure after the final whistle (Photo: Bongarts) 
The result puts increasing pressure on manager Arsene Wenger, with a large amount of supporters keen to see the Frenchman quit after another embarrassing defeat. 
His contract is up at the end of this season and board members want him to stay as boss but fan pressure is getting to him and he could walk away in May after 21 years in charge. Read More
